courses.name: Current Issues in Environment and Health

cmCourseInfo.description: This course introduces students to complex issues at the interface between environment and health where health is broadly defined. Each year a current and controversial case study is explored from scientific, medical, political and policy perspectives. The course takes students from the molecular to individual to population and societal levels.
cmCourseInfo.title: Current Issues in Environment and Health
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: 14 FCE complete, ENV341H1/ HMB302H1/HMB312H1/ HMB314H1/ HMB322H1

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
This course will be part of HMB pre-enrolment. Eligible program students will receive via email a ballot to rank eligible 400-level courses in order of preference between May 28 and June 29, with decisions confirmed July 6. Students who are not pre-enrolled in the course but meet the enrolment controls will be able to waitlist for the course once course enrolment starts.
